data.title: "Fix Dependencies" dialog doesn't open for tscn scenes
data.body:
When moving a dependency of a `tscn` scene file, then opening the scene, the only message is:

> **Alert!**
> Error loading scene.

For the same scene as a `scn` or `xscn` file, the "Fix Dependencies" dialog is opened instead.

data.title: Revert "Better search for SectionedPropertyEditor, added "All" section"

data.title: Animation IDs get reordered in the scene file in an arbitrary way
data.body:
reduz already fixed a while ago the ordering of most subresources that would get somewhat arbitrary in tscn/xscn files, where things would get reordered upon saving the scene even if they were not modified: fd836ca

It seems that a similar fix would be needed for specific animation IDs, see e.g. this recent commit in a game using the git master branch: https://github.com/KOBUGE-Games/project-kumquat/commit/953ceda59760131b9bc0c5ae5a81f75d1afd96ed#diff-7d71b035904a113bbc9b0a0ad762ef9dR98

```
@@ -94,10 +94,10 @@ transform/pos = Vector2( 2.46224, 0.769449 )

 [node name="movement_anim" parent="."]

-anims/die = SubResource( 3 )
-anims/walk_left = SubResource( 7 )
-anims/walk_down = SubResource( 4 )
-anims/walk_right = SubResource( 5 )
-anims/walk_up = SubResource( 6 )
+anims/walk_right = SubResource( 2 )
+anims/walk_down = SubResource( 3 )
+anims/die = SubResource( 4 )
+anims/walk_up = SubResource( 5 )
+anims/walk_left = SubResource( 6 )
```

(Note that the corresponding file before the commit was also made with a recent Godot version from git)

data.title: replace InputEvent references with GlobalScope in joystick doc
data.body:
When I originally wrote this, I was used to the c++ side of things where the `JOY_*` constants are defined in InputEvent.h. But in gdscript, they are actually bound to the global scope.

When looking for how to reference Global Scope, I found one other usage in `add_user_signal`. Well, apparently that was not the right way to do it :P 
So I also fixed that one.

data.title: Revert "Tree and PropertyEditor confirm value change on focus loss"
data.body: Reverts godotengine/godot#3407

data.title: Can't click tab when a graph node dialog is behind it
data.body:
The graph node dialog is capturing the mouse click:

![GIF](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7718100/12530535/fcfa27a6-c1e1-11e5-8a23-67d89d1facbe.gif)

data.title: Bottom panel's editor plugin's not getting keyboard signals
data.body: Also the same for actions and joybuttons i guess. I identified the problem but wans't able to solve this: CanvasItemEdiorPlugin and SpatialEditorPlugin are catching the key events and accepting before they reach bottom panel, this is the cause: The parenting goes like this: _center_split __top_split ___container ____scene_tabs _____scene_root_parent(Panel) _____scene_root_base (Control aparently not in use, duplicate of viewport above) _____scene_root (parent of the current edited scene, input is disabled) _____viewport (it's a Control, not a viewport) ______canvas_item_editor_plugin ______spatial_editor_plugin ______script_editor_plugin ___top_split_other_childs (some editors are aded here like shader editors) __bottom_panel ___v_container ____editors (animation, sprite_frames, sample_library, and many others not catching signals) ____h_container _____buttons_to_switch_editors somehow some editors like shader editors are catching the input, but not sprite_frames or sample_library.

data.title: close button in Debugger panel does not work - probably should not be there at all.
data.body:
In master compiled 8 hours ago pressing the X - close button in the upper right part of Debugger panel does nothing. Animation or Output panel do not have this button anymore. 
Right now closing this part of panel is possible only by pressing again the Debugger, Animation or Output buttons at the bottom of the screen.

data.title: Binded script lost.
data.body: This issue happened under the situation of the script is binding on a Resource(or subtype of Resource) and export the project with script compiled.

data.title: LineEdit changes confirmed by focus loss don't handle undoredo properly
data.body: Regression from the (otherwise super cool) #3407, so ping @TheHX :)

data.title: Changing SpinBox values in inspector is made unpractical by the "revert" button in instanced scenes
data.body:
![godot_spinbox_issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10758005/12523932/17cfcd98-c15a-11e5-864a-1f9377cb3549.png)
When you have an instanced scene, and want to change values in any SpinBox within the inspector by clicking the arrows, the "revert" button appears at every 2nd click on an arrow and by that causes an annoying resizing of the SpinBox. 1st click = revert appears, 2nd click = disappears, 3rd = appears, ....

The problem here is, that by resizing the SpinBox, the arrow buttons move around every time you click them. So you can't make a simple _klick, klick, klick_ to add +3 quickly, you always have to move around the mouse to find that arrow key again. Check the images for better understanding :grinning:

data.title: Selected items in ItemList are too offset to the left
data.body:
Related to #3096 and the PR that attempts to fix it, #3409. Once the background colour part of the issue is fixed, there is still the error that the selected item is too offset to the left, and thus the left part of the StyleBox is not visible. With PR #3409, it's extended to all items since the custom background colour will extend to the same width as the StyleBox selector, so it will also have a start position out of the ItemList panel.

Current status (with PR #3409, but without it's still similar for the StyleBox, only the background colour area changes):
![r pos x-4_](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/12518064/8424c3dc-c136-11e5-8982-73e8363f7427.png)

What it should be:
![r pos x1_](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/12518069/89055722-c136-11e5-90a6-44dd3dfb41f5.png)
(or maybe with a bit more offset between the left part of the StyleBox and the icon, i.e. the icon and text should be offset to the right a bit).

data.title: Access exported script vars on a scene that is not yet loaded and instanced
data.body:
**Lukas Sägesser:**
Is it somehow possible to read exported vars on a node in a scene that is not yet loaded and not yet instanced? While it is still being loaded with resource loader?

I like to use exported vars to configure on each level-scene the enemies and powerups that are allowed in this level. And I'd like to display info on these while the level is loading, to pass the time.

**Juan Alpaca:**
ah.. I think there is an API for this but not sure if it is exported to script, I guess it could be exported to script.

**Rémi Verschelde:** 
+1, for our current game with the Kobuge guys we also had to workaround this to display the characteristics of towers (defined as export vars in the tower scenes) in the game HUD, by instancing dummy tower scenes just for the HUD.

**Juan Alpaca:** 
make an issue request and mark it as a bug, as this API should be available to script

data.title: add gamepad mapping (ps4 pad, html5/win/firefox)
data.body:
On windows, this pad needs support for 18 buttons to function correctly.
So I also increased the number of buttons InputDefault can keep track of.

We'll have to test some more devices to see if there are ones that need more than 8 axes (or even more buttons)

data.title: Possible memory conflict with Photoshop
data.body:
Every time I run the latest Godot 2.0 development build and Photoshop CC 2015 (the newest version) at the same time my computer gives me a low memory warning and crashes unless I close one of the programs. Now is this related to Godot? I do not know but maybe someone else has had the same problem?
I'm on a 16GB  Windows 8.1 machine.

data.title: Added Xbox 360 Controller mapping for HTML5 output, see #3400
data.body: Little concerned about UID being the same as the already existing entry, but that's what the tool you linked to gave me.

data.title: Make custom_bg fit the whole "selected" area in ItemLists
data.body:
Note that as this changes the ItemList node itself, we might want to check its other usages before merging. I expanded the area covered by the custom background colour to match that of the StyleBox selector, so that the StyleBox gets filled completely by the colour in the script editor tabs (+ the previously selected scripts have a size similar to the selector's).

One other graphical glitch that would be worth fixing here is that the items of the ItemList are too much to the left, so the left part of the StyleBox is not visible. I haven't found how to do it yet though.

Before:
![e02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/12518296/2161d576-c138-11e5-8347-3c6f3c345b1b.png)

After:
![fd2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/12518298/22e84844-c138-11e5-91ef-8afdd23e5cbc.png)

(The thing to notice is that the StyleBox is completely coloured, and the other tabs' background has a similar size)

Closes #3096

data.title: EditorNode: Ignore unhandled input if there is a dialog visible
data.body: Fixes #1123

data.title: Tree and PropertyEditor confirm value change on focus loss
data.body:
When the value is edited using a LineEdit it the change will be confirmed on focus loss, pressing `Esc` key will cancel the change.

And i removed some unnecessary include files and a unused code used for editing color properties, the PropertyEditor uses the ColorPicker for editing this type.

Closes #1717.

data.title: Adding viewport node causes editor to go blank
data.body:
I had this happen when I tried it on a fresh windows build, and someone on the Facebook group also said they had this issue on a fresh linux build. I've just tried it on my linux (ubuntu) machine, but it appears to be okay here.. 

That's all the information I have at the moment, I'll see if I can add more later. Just wanted to bring attention to it in case anyone else was having this issue, or if anyone else was able to try it out on their machine.

data.title: Create a CollisionPolygon2D from image
data.body:
I would like to propose a feature to speed the creation of collisionpolygon2d.
A common case is to have an image with a transparent background and want to create a collisionpolygon2d which has the same shape as the outline of the image.

My proposal is a feature that to create a collisionpolygon from an image.

e.g. you can convert the image into a 2-color (black and transparent) and use the non-transparent color as shape to findup the vertices of the polygon.

data.title: set_signed_data now works correctly on pcm8 samples.
data.body: Fixes #3399.

data.title: Fix and improved Spinbox behaviour
data.body:
It was retrieving a wrong local mouse position, which could fail in some situations.
Improved the Tree spinbox behaviour a bit: the timer won't stop on mouse motion as long as the item is the same.

data.title: Can not assign .tscn file as main scene
data.body: Filter has only `*.scn, *.res, *.xscn, *.xml`

data.title: ResourceLoader doesn't recognize IMA_ADPCM sounds.
data.body:
It tries to load them as PCM8,but fails silently, leaving an empty sample.

Is it worth it to keep this apparent support for ADPCM, or should we drop it?

```
extends Button

var sound=ResourceLoader.load("res://Coin_ima.wav")
var voice=AudioServer.voice_create()

func _ready():
    AudioServer.voice_set_mix_rate(voice,44100)
    AudioServer.voice_set_volume(voice,1.0)
    connect("released",self,"_on_released")

func _on_released():
    AudioServer.voice_play(voice,sound.get_rid())
    print(sound.get_format())
```

In fact, when loading an IMA sample, get_format returns PCM8.

data.title: html5 gamepad support
data.body:
Adds joystick support to the javascript platform.
Also, the remapping system can now map axis events to the dpad.

I don't have all my gamepads at hand, so there are only a few mappings for now.
I tried to host my mapping tool on googledrive but only had limited success :P

data.title: AudioServer.sample_set_signed_data may overflow.
data.body:
AudioServer.sample_set_signed_data assumes the destination sample is SAMPLE_PCM16. If it tries to write that 16-bit sample to a 8-bit one, it could overflow (or, at least, give an illogical error). While I can make it convert to PCM8 as needed, I don't think I can pull the IMA_ADPCM (need info about the IMA preamble).
Should I put a console warning for IMA_ADPCM, and call it a day?

data.title: Some low-level audio documentation.
data.body:
Documented AudioServerSW, EventPlayer and EventStream*.
Corrections on AudioServer and Sample. Samples are measured in logical samples (which can contain more than one physical sample), not frames.

data.title: Center status display per flexbox in web export
data.body:
I used CSS tables for centering to support IE9, but although IE9 supports canvas, it doesn't support WebGL. Support begins with IE11, so we can just use flexbox.

Also hide the status' overlapping container, fixing:
- mouse button press events not arriving in canvas
- context menu opening with right click on canvas
